contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Convention | name = Yuricon | image = | caption = | status = Inactive | venue = Hilton Newark Penn Station | location = Newark, New Jersey | country = United States | first = 2003 | last = 2007 | organizer = Erica Friedman | attendance = 200 in 2003 | website = http://www.yuricon.org/ }} '''Yuricon''' was an [[anime convention]] geared toward fans of [[Yuri (genre)|yuri]] anime and manga.<ref name = "After Ellen"/> The first Yuricon event was held in 2003 in [[Newark, New Jersey]] with about 200 attending,<ref name="AC-2003" /> although Yuricon has existed as an online entity since 2000.<ref>[http://manga.about.com/od/mangaartistswriters/a/EFriedman_3.htm Erica Friedman Interview - Interview With Yuri Manga Publisher and Founder of YuriCon<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The event was organized by Yuricon, LLC., which continues to run Yuri-focused events of its own and to collaborate with other organizations to hold unique events. In 2005, Yuricon hosted an event in Tokyo and co-sponsored [[Onna!]], together with the Shoujo Arts Society, which focused on women's roles in animation and comics. In 2007, Yuricon ran a small one-day event to recreate the feel of the Tokyo event from 2005. Admission to convention events is restricted to people over the age of 18. Yuricon has a publishing arm, ALC Publishing, which is the only all-yuri publisher in the world.<ref name = "After Ellen">{{cite web|url=http://www.afterellen.com/people/2007/5/friedman |title=Yuricon Celebrates Lesbian Anime and Manga |last=Corson |first=Suzanne |publisher=[[AfterEllen.com]]|accessdate=2007-05-01 |year=2007}}</ref> Publications include translations from the Japanese, such as "[[Rica 'tte Kanji!?]]" and "WORKS," and the original English-language anthology series ''Yuri Monogatari''. Friedman has run guest lectures about yuri at the University of Illinois and MIT.<ref>http://services.lang.uiuc.edu/news/Friedman.asp</ref><ref>http://web.mit.edu/annualreports/pres03/09.14.html</ref> ==Programming== Like other anime conventions, Yuricon hosted several panels, cosplay events, [[anime music video]] contests, and other competitions. Yuricon also maintains a library of yuri manga for attendees to read.<ref>{{cite web | author = Lisa Z | url = http://magazine.anipike.com/index.php?article=68 | title = Convention Reports: Yuri Con 2003 | publisher = Anipike.com | accessdate = 2008-03-31}}</ref> ==History== ===Event history=== {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! Dates !! Location !! Atten. !! Guests {{Convention list | date = June 13â€“15, 2003 | venue = Gateway Hilton | location = [[Newark, New Jersey]] | attendance = 200 | guests = Dr. Sarah Frederick, Gaijin-a-gogo, Mike Hayes, Eriko Tadeno, Rica Takashima, and Kathryn Williams.<ref name="AC-2003">{{cite web | url = http://www.animecons.com/events/info.shtml/2 | title = Yuricon 2003 Information | publisher = AnimeCons.com | accessdate = 2008-02-10}}</ref> }} {{Convention list | date = April 16, 2005 | venue = | location = [[Tokyo, Japan]] | attendance = 30 | guests = Akiko Mizoguchi, Natsuko Mori, Eriko Tadeno, and Rica Takashima.<ref name="AC-2005">{{cite web | url = http://www.animecons.com/events/info.shtml/751 | title = Yuri Revolution 2005 Information | publisher = AnimeCons.com | accessdate = 2008-02-10}}</ref> }} {{Convention list | date = September 29, 2007 | venue = Hilton Newark Penn Station | location = Newark, New Jersey | attendance = | guests = Rica Takashima.<ref name="AC-2007">{{cite web | url = http://www.animecons.com/events/info.shtml/1131 | title = Yuricon 2007 Information | publisher = AnimeCons.com | accessdate = 2008-02-10}}</ref> }} |} ==Publications== *Yuri Monogatari (named for [[Nobuko Yoshiya]]'s ''Hana Monogatari'') is an annual anthology of yuri-themed short comics. In 2007, Yuri Monogatari 3 was nominated for the [[Lambda Book Award]].<ref>[http://okazu.blogspot.com/2007/09/yuri-monogatari-news_14.html Okazu: Yuri Monogatari News<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Five ''Yuri Monogatari'' anthologies have been published. [[The Advocate]] has called Yuri Monogatari a "must-have manga".<ref>http://www.advocate.com/issue_story_ektid62157.asp?page=1</ref> *Shoujoai ni Bouken *[[Rica 'tte Kanji!?]] *Works<ref>[http://www.yuricon.org/shop/manga.html#ALC 100% Yuri Publications from ALC Publishing<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.yuricon.org/ Yuricon official website] *[http://web.archive.org/web/*/http://www.shoujoarts.org Shoujo Arts Society official website] at [[Archive.org]] [[Category:Defunct anime conventions]] [[Category:Yuri (genre)]] [[Category:2003 establishments in New Jersey]]
